name: Murphy's River Lodge

reviews.text: We got a room here (late in the day) for one night on our way to Wyoming. The price was competitive, and Meredith at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Murphy's River Lodge is extremely close to downtown Estes Park, and the room we stayed in was larger than most hotel rooms, and very well-maintained. Slept great and loved being able to get up early and drive into Rocky Mountain National Park for a quick visit to my favorite waterfall before hitting the road.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd stay there again for sure.
reviews.title: Will definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Murphy's River Lodge. We were very pleased with the accomodations. The rooms were very clean, the bed linens were crisp and new, and the staff was extremely pleasant and welcoming. We had a great room with a good-sized balcony overlooking the river. The complimentary breakfast is offered in a large, well equipped room with a large selection of foods available. We especially loved the fact that the lodge is within easy walking distance to the shops and restaurants along Elkhorn Avenue. We will definitely stay here again when in Estes Park!
reviews.title: Great Place!
Great Hotel, Very Colorado, Clean and Comfortable!
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights over Memorial Day weekend and really enjoyed it. We stayed in the 'C' room, which is above and a little behind the office. It required climbing some narrow stairs, but that wasn't a problem for us. One nice surprise was when we checked in, the lady at the front desk informed us the owner had dropped the price after we made our reservation the previous week, so we got the room at the lower rate, saving us over $40! The room was very clean and spacious. The fridge and microwave came in handy. The free continental breakfast was adequate with several choices including cereal, pastries, hard boiled eggs (a little undercooked for my taste), oatmeal, etc. Downtown Estes Park is a short walk away, so you can even walk to dinner from the hotel if preferred. The day we arrived to check in, there were several elk right on the property and across the street, which was a nice surprise! We would definitely stay here again.

A perfect place to stay while visiting the Estes Park area. The room was modern, clean and comfortable with a great deck to sit on and watch the Fall River. The pool/hot tub felt great after visiting the National Park just a short distance from the lodge. Walking distance to town to shop and plenty of restaurants to enjoy. Appreciated the breakfast that is included and the friendly staff. Great place to stay!
reviews.title: Amazing clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place to stay. Perfect for a long weekend trip to beautiful Estes Park.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are fairly small but in great shape. Water is hot. Price point is right. Awesome indoor hot tub / pool. Nice balcony overlooking the river. Breakfast included. Centrally located, very close to town. Friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay!

reviews.text: Book with confidence and enjoy.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient
Very nice experience at Murphy's
reviews.text: We stayed here to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. It was a very enjoyable experience. We had a riverfront room with a full kitchen and plenty of space. We loved the sound of the river running outside our room. We sat on the deck and enjoyed the sounds and the view. We were within walking distance of downtown Estes Park and were a short drive to Rocky Mountain National Park. We stayed for 6 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. We will definitely stay here again if we ever get to come back to Estes Park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are having a great stay at Murphy's river lodge. The room is clean and comfortable with the two kids in the pull out bad and a nice king size for mom and dad. The kitchen has everything we need. This place is convenient to everything. You could walk into town although the walk is a little long for the little kids. Short drive to everything else. Internet is super reliable and fast. Pool temp was perfect. Hot tub a little on the hot side but still nice. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The room was beautiful to sit outside and watch the river roar by. The room was clean and stylist. Nice continent breakfast. My only problem was the thin walls the people upstairs woke us up at 2am with kids running around I know it not the lodge's fault but they should put families on the first floor.
reviews.title: The river in the backyard is beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely appointed room with private balcony right on the Fall River. The kitchen appliances, dishes, cutlery, and utensils were better quality than we usually see in vacation rentals. Each unit had a small charcoal grill, and the balconies had a nice table and chairs, which made sitting outside, watching the river and the hummingbirds, even nicer. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and unfailingly helpful. We really enjoyed our stay. And the deer and elk really DO come right down to the river to drink.
reviews.title: Perfect location, nicely appointed, friendly staff

reviews.text: Bed was supportive and comfortable but the down comforter was way too hot for summer. Even with the individual A/C unit, we were warm at night. Bath was small. Pictures nicer than place is. But nice staff and decent continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Nothing terrible, nothing great.

reviews.text: We have stayed at Murphys Lodge 2 different times in 2 months, and we are driving 12 hours to get there. Our first visit was on a groupon. We enjoyed our first stay so much we decided to come back as soon as we had time off. The staff is WONDERFUL! The location is beautiful, there is a community firepit, grills for guests to use, and yard games and a selection of DVD's at the front desk. I told the manager when I checked out that I am afraid to tell people how wonderful this place is because I do not want to worry about the "no vacancy" sign on when we pull up. I wish them well with their second location in Estes as well. We will be returning customers. -mike (Sam)
reviews.title: The people who work there are amazing; made our trip a great experience.
Great place to stay!
reviews.text: This place is great! Wonderful staff and perfect location. Loretta ordered my family a pizza and had it sent to our room as we weren't arriving till late and had not eaten. The rooms are spacious, inexpensive and our room backed to the river. There was a great complimentary breakfast and we were in walking distance to all of the wonderful shops and restaurants. We would definitely stay here when we return to Estes Park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location being able to walk to town and short drive to the park. There is a small lodge, but most of the rooms are in a motel-type setup with outdoor passageways. We spent 2 nights in a large 2nd floor room with king bed, sofa and fireplace. Love the balcony overlooking the river. Our room had a tiny bathroom (about 5 x 6 ft) with toilet and tub. Sink in the main room--not my preference. Small refrigerator and microwave in the room. More noise than I expect from adjoining rooms. Complimentary DVDs to check out at office. Serviceable continental breakfast--nothing special, but Michelle does a nice job managing the room. Didn't use the pool and hot tub, but they looked nice enough.
reviews.title: Balcony on the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and really enjoyed our stay - we were located in the main lodge (above the office) in a spotless room with a very comfortable king-sized bed. The sink was located in the room, separate from the shower/toilet, which made it convenient to get ready in the morning. The room featured a flat-screen tv, DVD player, two chairs (with foot rests) and a small table, small fridge/freezer, microwave, hair dryer, ironing board, iron, one-cup coffee maker, and lots of storage space. The room also had a small balcony (with chairs) that looked over the parking lot but had views of the river. Breakfast was a selection of cereals, hard-boiled eggs, toast, bagels, muffins, Danish, yogurts, juices, coffee & tea and the back of the upstairs breakfast room has a deck with tables & chairs that overlook the river and make for a very pleasant outdoor dining experience. There are also Adirondack chairs & picnic tables near the river for relaxing, and I think I spotted a grill although we did not use it.
reviews.title: Good value in a great location

reviews.text: This was an excellent value for the money (we booked a king-size value room) and within a few short blocks of downtown Estes Park, making it easy to walk to restaurants, shops, etc. The front-desk staff was incredibly helpful, providing maps and suggestions for good dining options. The office also features movies to borrow and sells bottled water for a dollar, if you're planning on an early-morning hike and forgot to stock up on water the night before. Despite its central location, the lodge was quiet for sleeping and the other guests were also quiet - it was very full but we heard very little noise.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Estes Park

reviews.text: This lodge is a perfect location from which to explore Rocky Mountain National Park. The entrance to the park is right up the street. The town is a 10 minute walk to a bunch of little shops. Yet when you're at the motel, it's extremely quiet and peaceful. The rooms are perfect - clean, cheerful, beds are comfortable. Continental breakfast is plentiful. Pool and hot tub are great. The people who run the lodge are very friendly and extremely helpful. We travel quite a bit and I loved this place. The park itself is spectacular. Lots of elk, moose, goats, picas etc.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Were do I start. We had booked into another hotel but did not like what we got. We called around and found Murphy's....We had looked at this initially but it was a little to much for our budget, however because this was now a last minute reservation it was much less expensive. We were in a condo unit over looking the river. The staff was excellent and the pool was nice.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!

description: Murphy's River Lodge is located 2 blocks from downtown Estes Park and backs to the Fall River. Murphy's was remodeled in 2011 and has a reputation of having the friendliest staff in town. Your stay at Murphy's comes with free wifi,free breakfast,indoor heated pool and hot tub,20 River front rooms ,6 pet friendly rooms and several value rooms for our friends on a tighter budget.
